test_description: This test covers the basics of computer networks, including network hardware, software, protocol layering, reference models (OSI and TCP/IP), and network devices.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a use of computer networks?
What is the primary function of a router in a network?
questions.options_a: To connect devices within a LAN
questions.options_b: To forward packets between different networks
questions.options_c: To amplify signals in a network
questions.options_d: To convert digital signals to analog

questions.question: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for logical addressing and routing?
How many layers are there in the TCP/IP reference model?
Which device operates at the Data Link layer of the OSI model?
What is the main purpose of protocol layering in network communication?
questions.options_b: To simplify network design and implementation
questions.options_c: To reduce the number of network devices needed

questions.question: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for establishing, managing, and terminating sessions?
What is the primary difference between a hub and a switch?
questions.options_a: A hub operates at Layer 2 while a switch operates at Layer 1
questions.options_b: A hub broadcasts data to all ports while a switch sends data only to the intended recipient
questions.options_c: A switch is slower than a hub
questions.options_d: A hub can connect to the internet while a switch cannot

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a network topology?
What is the purpose of the Application layer in the OSI model?
questions.options_a: To provide network services directly to user applications
questions.options_d: To control error detection and correction

questions.question: Which protocol suite is commonly used for internet communication?
What is the main advantage of the TCP/IP model over the OSI model?
questions.options_c: It is more widely implemented in practice

questions.question: Which device operates at the Physical layer of the OSI model?
What is the purpose of a network interface card (NIC)?
questions.options_a: To connect a computer to a network
questions.options_d: To convert analog signals to digital

questions.question: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for data compression and encryption?
What is the main function of the Transport layer in the OSI model?
Which of the following is a connection-oriented protocol?
What is the purpose of a gateway in networking?
questions.options_b: To connect dissimilar networks using different protocols

questions.question: Which layer of the OSI model handles flow control and error recovery?
What is the primary function of a bridge in a network?
questions.options_b: To connect two similar networks and filter traffic based on MAC addresses
questions.options_c: To route packets based on IP addresses
questions.options_d: To amplify signals in a network
